text: A voiced bilabial affricate ( in IPA) is a rare affricate consonant that is initiated as a bilabial stop and released as a voiced bilabial fricative . It has not been reported to occur phonemically in any language. == Features == Features of the voiced bilabial affricate: == Occurrence == {| class="wikitable" !colspan=2| Language !! Word !! IPA !! Meaning !! Notes |- |rowspan=3|English || Broad Cockney || rowspan=3 | rub || rowspan=2 | || rowspan=3 | 'rub' || Sporadic allophone of . title: Voiced bilabial affricate
